intro: Darwinia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered darwinia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. Darwinia biflora typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. It is a hardy perennial that produces its flowers during the spring and summer months.
